question: What is diginu?
answer: diginu is an online food delivery app that not only has much cheaper rates but also offers you the opportunity to earn recurring commissions.

question: How do I earn with diginu?
aliases: how can i earn with diginu?
answer: You can earn a few ways with diginu. You can earn from our delivery side (customers and merchants), our rewards programme (diginuCashBack) and our electric bikes (diginuEgo).

question: What is diginuCashBack?
answer: diginuCashBack is our rewards programme, where you can save every day as well as create an income every time the people that you referred pay their membership.

question: Can someone be moved if they signed up wrong?
aliases: what if they register under wrong person
answer: If someone registered under another person they cannot be moved (we have a 'registered for life' policy). If they accidentally registered under the company, you can email enrollerchange@diginu.com to request a move, but it must be within 7 days of that person registering.

question: How do I cancel my diginuCashBack debit order?
aliases: remove my banking details from diginucashback
how do i stop diginucashback payment
how do i remove my bank details from diginu
how do i cancel cashback debit order
answer: To cancel your diginuCashBack debit order and remove your banking details, you must email cashback@diginu.com. This cannot be done in your profile or app settings — all cancellations are processed by our support team via email. Be sure to include your full name, ID number, and registered phone number in your email so they can locate your account.

question: What is diginuEgo?
aliases: tell me about the diginuego bike
answer:
diginuEgo is an AI-powered electric motorbike designed for modern mobility in Africa. It pairs smart security and live tracking with practical daily performance, making it ideal for commuting, delivery work, and fleet use.

  • Electric, mid-drive motor
  • Live tracking dashboard
  • Remote power-off (anti-theft)
  • Swappable lithium-ion batteries
  • Fleet management ready

It’s built for reliability, affordability and real-world convenience.

question: What are the key features of diginuEgo?
aliases: what makes the ego bike special
answer:
• AI & Telematics: live tracking dashboard for visibility and control
  • Remote Power-Off: disable the bike remotely if stolen
  • Swappable Batteries: keep riding by swapping packs (no long downtime)
  • Strong Braking: front & rear disc brakes (240mm)
  • Comfort & Handling: upside-down front fork + rear monoshock
  • Built for Work: fleet management functionality
  • Everyday Practicality: suitable for commuting, school or work

question: What are the technical specifications of diginuEgo?
aliases: what are the specs of the ego bike
answer:
• Brakes: front & rear disc brakes (240mm)
  • Front Suspension: upside-down (inverted) telescopic fork
  • Rear Suspension: monoshock
  • Wheelbase: 1350 mm
  • Seat Height: 815 mm (rider)
  • Carrying Capacity: up to 150 kg
  • Motor: mid-drive, 3000 W
  • Battery: lithium-ion, swappable
  • Pack Voltage: 65–72 V
  • Energy: ~4.3 kWh

question: What is the battery, range and charging time for diginuEgo?
aliases: how long to charge ego bike
answer:
• Battery: lithium-ion, swappable packs
  • Charging: ~80% in < 3 hours, ~100% in < 4.5 hours
  • Range (Eco): ~105–120 km*
  • Range (Normal): ~75–90 km*
  • Range (Sport): ~65–70 km*

*Actual range varies with load, terrain and riding style.

question: How much does the diginuEgo cost?
aliases: what is the price of the ego bike
answer:
The diginuEgo bike is priced at R89,900 (incl. VAT). Licensing and admin fees are excluded.

Interested in ordering or a quote? Contact us and we’ll assist.

question: Does the diginuEgo have anti-theft and tracking?
aliases: can ego be disabled if stolen
answer:
• Remote power-off: disable the bike over the internet if stolen
  • Live tracking dashboard: monitor location and status in real-time
  • Fleet visibility: centralised oversight for multiple bikes

These features are part of diginu’s focus on secure, reliable mobility.

question: Where can I see diginuEgo videos and demos?
aliases: how to swap the battery video
answer:
• Bike screen / panel: https://youtu.be/gh79U9_4ihg
  • Battery swap demo: https://youtu.be/EUOo8SXl6sU
  • How the bike looks: https://youtu.be/NBtCJRi35jk

question: Is the diginuEgo good for delivery riders and commuting?
aliases: is the ego practical for commuting
ego bike for school or work
answer:
Yes. diginuEgo is designed for daily use with low running costs and minimal downtime thanks to swappable batteries. The suspension, braking and mid-drive configuration support predictable handling in urban traffic.

For delivery teams, live tracking and remote control improve safety and operational oversight.

question: Does the diginuEgo support fleet management?
aliases: does ego integrate with fleet tools
answer: Yes. The platform includes fleet management functionality with a live dashboard for location, usage and control. This helps teams optimise deployment, monitor security, and reduce downtime.

question: Are there plans for battery swapping or charging stations?
aliases: when will ego have battery swap stations
answer: Yes. From 2026, diginu plans to roll out battery swapping and charging stations across the country, with solar and wind generation at many sites. This supports faster turnarounds and lower operating costs for riders and fleets.

question: How do I withdraw cash from my diginuPay wallet?
aliases: how to cash out from diginupay
where can I withdraw diginupay money
answer:
You can withdraw cash from your diginuPay wallet using a cashout voucher sent to your phone. Here’s how it works:

  • Open your diginuPay app and request a cash withdrawal
  • You will receive an SMS with a Nedbank MobiMoney voucher code
  • Go to any supported store or ATM and use the voucher to withdraw cash

Where you can withdraw:

  • Nedbank ATMs
  • Checkers, Shoprite, Pick n Pay, OK, Usave, Boxer & House and Home
  • Kazang partner stores nationwide

diginuPay is integrated with Nedbank MobiMoney, giving you thousands of withdrawal locations across South Africa for easy access.

question: Thank you
answer: You are most welcome

question: What are the fees for withdrawing cash from diginuPay?
aliases: how much does it cost to withdraw
answer:
Withdrawal fees depend on the withdrawal method and are shown before you confirm the cashout in the app. You’ll always see the fee and total amount you will receive.

  • Generate a Nedbank MobiMoney voucher in your diginuPay app
  • Fees are clearly displayed at checkout
  • Some partner locations may show fees on the till/ATM screen

Tip: If something looks incorrect, cancel and try again or contact support.

Need help? wecare@diginu.com

question: What are the daily withdrawal limits on diginuPay?
aliases: how much can i withdraw per day
answer:
Withdrawal and transaction limits help protect your account and may vary based on your verification (KYC) status.

  • Limits are shown at the point of withdrawal
  • Higher limits may require ID verification
  • Multiple withdrawals per day are allowed within your limit

Security note: diginuPay may request extra verification to keep your funds safe.

Questions? wecare@diginu.com

question: Can I transfer money wallet-to-wallet on diginuPay?
aliases: send money to another diginupay user
answer:
Yes, you can make instant wallet-to-wallet transfers to any diginuPay user.

  • Open the app → Transfer → select/browse recipient
  • Confirm amount and reference
  • Recipient is notified instantly

Security note: Only send to people you trust and double-check the recipient details before confirming.

question: How do I transfer money from diginuPay to my bank account?
answer:
You can transfer to a South African bank account from within the app.

  • Add or select your bank beneficiary
  • Enter amount and confirm
  • Processing times vary by bank and method

Security note: For your protection, diginuPay may verify your identity before enabling bank transfers.

Need assistance? wecare@diginu.com

question: How do I receive money in my diginuPay wallet?
aliases: how can someone send me money
answer:
There are a few ways to receive money:

  • Another user sends you a wallet-to-wallet transfer
  • You receive funds from a merchant payout or commission
  • You deposit using any available top-up method in the app

You’ll get a notification when funds land.

question: Which banks and cards are supported by diginuPay?
aliases: can i use nedbank capitec fnb
does my bank work with diginupay
answer:
diginuPay works with major South African banks for transfers and voucher cashouts via Nedbank MobiMoney. Card support and methods may vary by feature.

  • Withdrawals: Nedbank ATMs and partner retailers via voucher
  • Transfers: to SA bank accounts (processing times may vary)
  • Cards/Instant EFT: availability shown in app during checkout

Check your app for the latest supported options.

question: I didn’t receive my voucher SMS — what should I do?
answer:
If your Nedbank MobiMoney voucher SMS hasn’t arrived:

  • Confirm your phone has signal and isn’t in Do Not Disturb
  • Check your number in Profile is correct
  • Wait a few minutes and try resend if available
  • If still missing, cancel and generate a new voucher

Note: Some networks can delay SMS delivery. If it persists, contact us with your attempted time and amount.

Support: wecare@diginu.com

question: My voucher expired — can I still withdraw?
answer:
Expired vouchers can’t be redeemed. Simply generate a new voucher in the app and use it at an eligible ATM or retailer.

  • Check the validity window when you create the voucher
  • Only share codes with trusted cashiers

If you’re unsure whether a voucher was used, contact support and we’ll help trace it.

question: My cash withdrawal failed — how do I fix it?
answer:
Try these steps:

  • Confirm the voucher code matches your SMS
  • Use a listed Nedbank ATM or supported retailer
  • Check you’re selecting Nedbank MobiMoney at the till/ATM
  • Ensure you’re within the voucher’s validity and your daily limit

If it still fails, note the time, store/ATM, and error message, then contact us.

Support: wecare@diginu.com

question: How do I update my bank details in diginuPay?
answer:
You can update your payout/bank details from your profile or payments section in the app.

  • Open Profile → Bank details
  • Edit account name/number/branch
  • Save and verify if prompted

Security note: For your protection, we may request ID verification when changing bank details.

question: How do I add or link a bank account to diginuPay?
answer:
To link a bank account for payouts:

  • Go to Profile → Bank details
  • Enter your bank, account number and branch info
  • Save and complete any verification steps

Once linked, you can transfer from your wallet to your bank.

question: How do I deposit money into my diginuPay wallet?
answer:
Open your app and choose a top-up option available to you. Methods may include card, EFT, or other providers displayed in-app.

  • Choose your method and amount
  • Follow the prompts to complete payment
  • We’ll notify you when funds arrive

Note: Processing times vary by method.

question: Why is my payment pending in diginuPay?
aliases: why is my transaction still pending
answer:
Pending means your payment is still being processed by the bank or provider. This is normal for EFT and some card methods.

  • Most pendings resolve automatically
  • Times vary by bank/weekend/public holidays
  • If it exceeds the usual window, contact support with your reference

question: How do reversals and refunds work on diginuPay?
answer:
Refunds and reversals depend on the original payment method and provider rules.

  • In-app transfers are usually final
  • Card/EFT payments may require a provider dispute
  • We’ll help investigate if funds didn’t arrive or were duplicated

Start by sharing the date, amount and reference with support.

Contact: wecare@diginu.com

question: Why is my diginuPay account locked or flagged?
answer:
Accounts can be temporarily restricted for security or compliance reasons (e.g., unusual activity, incorrect details, or pending KYC checks).

  • Check your email/app notifications for instructions
  • Complete any requested ID verification
  • Contact support if you need help resolving it

These checks help keep your money safe and prevent fraud.
